HERP.content: [re: Heidegger] what assures homology of to auton, the reversible tautology btwn polemos and philein, what gathers tautology w/ itself, is logos > “philology,” tautology is otology
HERP.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger] what assures homology of to auton, the reversible tautology btwn polemos and philein, what gathers tautology w/ itself, is logos > “philology,” tautology is otology

HERP.content: an originary enmity in Heidegger, Feindschaft, gives a reconciliation btwn friendship & enmity, a reconciliation carried in the same ordeal (épreuve), in non-identical-sameness
HERP.linkedContent: an originary enmity in Heidegger, Feindschaft, gives a reconciliation btwn friendship & enmity, a reconciliation carried in the same ordeal (épreuve), in non-identical-sameness

PP.content: same that is not identical, common element or medium of any possible dissociation
PP.linkedContent: same that is not identical, common element or medium of any possible dissociation

PP.content: no repetition possible w/out graphics of supplementarity, supplies for lack of full unity, being enough the same and enough the other to replace by addition (en ajoutant)
PP.linkedContent: no repetition possible w/out graphics of supplementarity, supplies for lack of full unity, being enough the same and enough the other to replace by addition (en ajoutant)

PP.content: pharmakon is the same because it has no identity, the same (is) as supplement, in differance, in writing
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is the same because it has no identity, the same (is) as supplement, in differance, in writing

VM.content: acc. Levinas, to see, know, have and will “unfold only within the oppressive and luminous identity of the same” (fundamental categories of ontology/phenomenology)
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, to see, know, have and will “unfold only within the oppressive and luminous identity of the same” (fundamental categories of ontology/phenomenology)

VM.content: for Levinas, history a blinding to the other, laborious procession of the same
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, history a blinding to the other, laborious procession of the same

VM.content: Derrida stresses that one will not be able to follow Levinas [in Totality and Infinity] if one is not convinced by equation ego = same, or by idea that rebellion against same is purely intelligible
VM.linkedContent: Derrida stresses that one will not be able to follow Levinas [in Totality and Infinity] if one is not convinced by equation ego = same, or by idea that rebellion against same is purely intelligible

VM.content: for Levinas, classical dissymmetry of same and other feigns overturning while remaining the same, impassive beneath an algebraic substitution
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, classical dissymmetry of same and other feigns overturning while remaining the same, impassive beneath an algebraic substitution

VM.content: acc. Levinas, concepts anticipate a horizon w/in which alterity is amortized as soon as it is announced—because foreseen, horizon always horizon of the same
VM.linkedContent: acc. Levinas, concepts anticipate a horizon w/in which alterity is amortized as soon as it is announced—because foreseen, horizon always horizon of the same

VM.content: for Levinas, infinitely-other cannot be thought on basis of the same
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, infinitely-other cannot be thought on basis of the same

VM.content: God’s face commands while hiding, more and less a face than all faces, face neither face of God nor figure of man but their resemblance, a resemblance thought w/out the Same
VM.linkedContent: God’s face commands while hiding, more and less a face than all faces, face neither face of God nor figure of man but their resemblance, a resemblance thought w/out the Same

VM.content: w/out using these terms, Levinas warns against confusing idem (same) w/ ipse (ego), identity w/ ipseity > this happens immediately w/ Greek and German: autos, selbst
VM.linkedContent: w/out using these terms, Levinas warns against confusing idem (same) w/ ipse (ego), identity w/ ipseity > this happens immediately w/ Greek and German: autos, selbst

VM.content: why must Levinas obliterate notion of spatiality re: the other, w/out erasing it, w/out making it illegible? > must he state infinity’s excess in language of the Same [inside-outside]?
VM.linkedContent: why must Levinas obliterate notion of spatiality re: the other, w/out erasing it, w/out making it illegible? > must he state infinity’s excess in language of the Same [inside-outside]?

VM.content: if, as Levinas says, same is violent, finite totality, then it would be more other than the other (an other totality), it would not be the same, it could not be posed w/out becoming other than itself (this is war) (“war there is”)
VM.linkedContent: if, as Levinas says, same is violent, finite totality, then it would be more other than the other (an other totality), it would not be the same, it could not be posed w/out becoming other than itself (this is war) (“war there is”)

VM.content: how could there be “play of the Same” if alterity were not already in the same?
VM.linkedContent: how could there be “play of the Same” if alterity were not already in the same?

VM.content: infinitely other & infinitely same, if they have meaning for a finite being, is the same
VM.linkedContent: infinitely other & infinitely same, if they have meaning for a finite being, is the same

VM.content: btwn original tragedy and messianic triumph there is philosophy, in which violence returned against violence, in which original finitude appears, in which other is respected w/in, by, the same
VM.linkedContent: btwn original tragedy and messianic triumph there is philosophy, in which violence returned against violence, in which original finitude appears, in which other is respected w/in, by, the same

VM.content: for Heidegger, same is not a category, it is not the identical, not negation of difference
VM.linkedContent: for Heidegger, same is not a category, it is not the identical, not negation of difference

VM.content: thought of Being is thought of other before homogenous identity of concept, before asphyxiation of the same?
VM.linkedContent: thought of Being is thought of other before homogenous identity of concept, before asphyxiation of the same?

PAS.content: two pas’ do not touch in the same (must not, need not, that’s how it works et que ça saute); that’s how marks are left (by Blanchot); marking time, pas marks pas
PAS.linkedContent: two pas’ do not touch in the same (must not, need not, that’s how it works et que ça saute); that’s how marks are left (by Blanchot); marking time, pas marks pas

VP.content: telos, Kant’s regulative idea, a guard against threat of losing presence > indefinite repetition of the same
VP.linkedContent: telos, Kant’s regulative idea, a guard against threat of losing presence > indefinite repetition of the same

VP.content: same remains the same only through ideality
absolute ideality is correlate of a possibility of indefinite repetition of the same > being for Husserl is ideality as repetition
VP.linkedContent: absolute ideality is correlate of a possibility of indefinite repetition of the same > being for Husserl is ideality as repetition

VP.content: ideality of the form of presence can be repeated to infinity as return of the same, but retained in a finite movement
VP.linkedContent: ideality of the form of presence can be repeated to infinity as return of the same, but retained in a finite movement

VP.content: differance in auto-affection = identity of identity and non-identity in the same of the instant
VP.linkedContent: differance in auto-affection = identity of identity and non-identity in the same of the instant

VP.content: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same
VP.linkedContent: the complicity of idealization and the voice are unfailing: brings monstration [?] to completion; unity of phonē and technē, voice as technical mastery of the object, via objectivity of object > the ideal object can be repeated, to infinity, while remaining the same

VP.content: auto-affection produces the same in difference w/ itself, same as non-identical
VP.linkedContent: auto-affection produces the same in difference w/ itself, same as non-identical

FSW.content: differance & identity, differance in economy of the same

SH.content: shibboleth secures passage from one to other in difference, w/in sameness > ambiguities of French partage
SH.linkedContent: shibboleth secures passage from one to other in difference, w/in sameness > ambiguities of French partage

FWT.content: differance is at once: the same (living being, but deferred, supplemented by technology, prosthesis) and the other (absolutely heterogenous, wholly other, death, irreducible, untranslatable); ——differance can both interrupt laws and introduce economy of new configuration into living being, it can both be reinscribed in economy of the same and opened to excess of tout autre
FWT.linkedContent: differance is at once: the same (living being, but deferred, supplemented by technology, prosthesis) and the other (absolutely heterogenous, wholly other, death, irreducible, untranslatable); ——differance can both interrupt laws and introduce economy of new configuration into living being, it can both be reinscribed in economy of the same and opened to excess of tout autre

POOF.content: Cicero combines the meanings of exemplum (copy, reproduction, duplicate) and exemplar (portrait, single original) to describe the hope friendship provides beyond death: Cicero stresses sameness, ideal double, as condition of survival
POOF.linkedContent: Cicero combines the meanings of exemplum (copy, reproduction, duplicate) and exemplar (portrait, single original) to describe the hope friendship provides beyond death: Cicero stresses sameness, ideal double, as condition of survival

POOF.content: in Menexenus, solid friendship (reconciliation) based on actual kinship (suggéneia), on homogeneity, homophilia, solid/firm affinity (bébaion) stemming from birth, native community, syngenealogy: this is a phantasm, what Joyce calls in Ulysses, re: the father, a ‘legal fiction’
POOF.linkedContent: in Menexenus, solid friendship (reconciliation) based on actual kinship (suggéneia), on homogeneity, homophilia, solid/firm affinity (bébaion) stemming from birth, native community, syngenealogy: this is a phantasm, what Joyce calls in Ulysses, re: the father, a ‘legal fiction’

POOF.content: eugenicism (eugéneia) as authochtony, proper birth, homage to earth & mother go hand in hand with fraternization: an equality of birth compatible w/ aristocracy
POOF.linkedContent: eugenicism (eugéneia) as authochtony, proper birth, homage to earth & mother go hand in hand with fraternization: an equality of birth compatible w/ aristocracy

OS.content: the now, presence in the act of the present: l’impossibilité de coexister avec soi: avec soi, c’est-à-dire, avec un autre soi, un autre maintenant, un autre même, un double
OS.linkedContent: the now, presence in the act of the present: l’impossibilité de coexister avec soi: avec soi, c’est-à-dire, avec un autre soi, un autre maintenant, un autre même, un double

OS.content: this impossibility contradicts itself, time is name for possibility of impossible, this impossible possibility: alterity & identity of the now maintained in a differentiated element of a certain same
OS.linkedContent: this impossibility contradicts itself, time is name for possibility of impossible, this impossible possibility: alterity & identity of the now maintained in a differentiated element of a certain same

POS.content: differance common root of oppositional concepts, as common root, is also element of the same (distinguished from the identical [Heidegger]) in which oppositions are announced
POS.linkedContent: differance common root of oppositional concepts, as common root, is also element of the same (distinguished from the identical [Heidegger]) in which oppositions are announced

Gii.content: Heidegger’s unity [re: Geschlecht], not identity, but preserves the simplicity of the same—even in the form of the fold
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s unity [re: Geschlecht], not identity, but preserves the simplicity of the same—even in the form of the fold

PIO.content: igitur or donc [re: “Fable”] speaks for a psyche, to it/her, before it/her, on subject of psyche, which has become pivoting speculum that relates the same to the other
PIO.linkedContent: igitur or donc [re: “Fable”] speaks for a psyche, to it/her, before it/her, on subject of psyche, which has become pivoting speculum that relates the same to the other

PIO.content: the government’s aleatory margin (for invention) remains homogenous w/ calculation (programmed invention) > w/in order of the calculable: no absolute surprise, order of the same
PIO.linkedContent: the government’s aleatory margin (for invention) remains homogenous w/ calculation (programmed invention) > w/in order of the calculable: no absolute surprise, order of the same

PIO.content: but Derrida will not oppose deconstruction (not passivity), the invention of the other, to government’s program: because opposition belongs to regimen of the same
PIO.linkedContent: but Derrida will not oppose deconstruction (not passivity), the invention of the other, to government’s program: because opposition belongs to regimen of the same

LI.content: repeatability of same ensures that full presence of a singularity, in being repeated, references something else, thus rending the full presence it announces
LI.linkedContent: repeatability of same ensures that full presence of a singularity, in being repeated, references something else, thus rending the full presence it announces

LI.content: this something else is where iteration is different from simple repetition
LI.linkedContent: this something else is where iteration is different from simple repetition

ATM.content: every present remains w/in the economic sphere of the same
ATM.linkedContent: every present remains w/in the economic sphere of the same

ATM.content: how can Levinas inscribe le tout autre in language of being, of the present, w/in its syntax, lexicon, under its law? > or: cette langue n’est pas d’elle-même déliée, opens to tout autre?
ATM.linkedContent: how can Levinas inscribe le tout autre in language of being, of the present, w/in its syntax, lexicon, under its law? > or: cette langue n’est pas d’elle-même déliée, opens to tout autre?

ATM.content: doing so in a way, where the fault (la faute) [see p. 149 Derrida’s fault, failing], which consists in inscribing tout autre in empire of same, alters the same enough to absolve it of itself
ATM.linkedContent: doing so in a way, where the fault (la faute) [see p. 149 Derrida’s fault, failing], which consists in inscribing tout autre in empire of same, alters the same enough to absolve it of itself

AD.content: Levinas proposes a teaching via welcoming that gives/receives something else, not ruse of master who feigns effacement behind figure of midwife
AD.linkedContent: Levinas proposes a teaching via welcoming that gives/receives something else, not ruse of master who feigns effacement behind figure of midwife

AD.content: maieutics, stuck in the same, teaches me nothing, only what is already in myself: même, egomet ipse, medisme, pouvoir savoir, property, gathers in itself (rassemble en lui-même) capacity & knowing
AD.linkedContent: maieutics, stuck in the same, teaches me nothing, only what is already in myself: même, egomet ipse, medisme, pouvoir savoir, property, gathers in itself (rassemble en lui-même) capacity & knowing

WOG.content: hen diapheron heautôi (Heraclitus) is Greek heritage Derrida is most faithful to, tries to think this “one differing from itself” alongside (“improbably”) the khōra > the very event of the même, the soi-même: under this sign, Derrida contrasted differance to ontological difference [cf. DIF p. 22]
WOG.linkedContent: hen diapheron heautôi (Heraclitus) is Greek heritage Derrida is most faithful to, tries to think this “one differing from itself” alongside (“improbably”) the khōra > the very event of the même, the soi-même: under this sign, Derrida contrasted differance to ontological difference [cf. DIF p. 22]

OG.content: writing of difference, fabric (tissu) of trace, permits difference btwn space & time to be articulated in unity of “same” proper body, permits graphic chain to be adapted to a spoken chain > difference is articulation
OG.linkedContent: writing of difference, fabric (tissu) of trace, permits difference btwn space & time to be articulated in unity of “same” proper body, permits graphic chain to be adapted to a spoken chain > difference is articulation

OG.content: auto-affection constitutes the same (auto) as it divides the same
OG.linkedContent: auto-affection constitutes the same (auto) as it divides the same

EU.content: for Schelling, thinking as Einbildungskraft, as post-Kantian originary unity > all differences translations of same > post-critical, critique of critique
EU.linkedContent: for Schelling, thinking as Einbildungskraft, as post-Kantian originary unity > all differences translations of same > post-critical, critique of critique
